docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: One factor never mentioned in these discussions is the disastrous effect abstinence-only education, as currently taught, has on our gay youth (''More Teenagers Say No to Sex'').
docs.abstract: Ed White letter on December 23 article about teenagers and abstinence poses concerns about gay youths who are told sex is only appropriate when married (S)
docs.snippet: To the Editor:    One factor never mentioned in these discussions is the disastrous effect abstinence-only education, as currently taught, has on our gay youth (''More Teenagers Say No to Sex'').

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Although I am sure it is a combination of factors causing the recent decline in teenage birthrates (''More Teenagers Say No to Sex''), I have seen another possible reason.
docs.abstract: Roberta Becker letter on December 23 article about teenage pregnancy suggests that viewing birth on television could deter young people from engaging in risky behavior (S)
docs.snippet: To the Editor:    Although I am sure it is a combination of factors causing the recent decline in teenage birthrates (''More Teenagers Say No to Sex''), I have seen another possible reason.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re ''More Teenagers Say No to Sex, and Experts Aren't Sure Why'' (Dec. 23):
docs.abstract: Drs Beth Weitzman and Adria Gallup-Black letter on December 23 article on declining teen pregnancy suggests that public health problems are cyclical in nature and statistics will inevitably rise as public becomes complacent (S)
docs.snippet: To the Editor:    Re ''More Teenagers Say No to Sex, and Experts Aren't Sure Why'' (Dec. 23):
